definitions.definition: A road that is raised so as to be above water , marshland , and similar low-lying obstacles , which in some cases may flood periodically (e.g. due to tides ). Originally causeways were much like dykes , generally pierced to let water through, whereas many modern causeways are more like bridges or viaducts .

main_definition: A road that is raised so as to be above water , marshland , and similar low-lying obstacles , which in some cases may flood periodically (e.g. due to tides ). Originally causeways were much like dykes , generally pierced to let water through, whereas many modern causeways are more like bridges or viaducts .
